meanings.definition: An underlying or implicit meaning in a piece of writing or conversation.
meanings.sent1: The subtext of the story hinted at the character's true feelings.
meanings.sent2: The subtext of the play added depth to the dialogue.
meanings.sent3: The subtext of the joke was cleverly hidden until the punchline.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes revealed a subtext of sadness beneath her smile.
meanings.sent5: The subtext of the painting spoke louder than the colors themselves.

meanings.definition: The underlying theme or message in a work of art or literature.
meanings.sent1: The subtext of the novel explored themes of love and loss.
meanings.sent2: The subtext of the film conveyed a powerful social commentary.
meanings.sent3: The subtext of the poem made the reader reflect on deeper meanings.
meanings.sent4: His music had a subtext that resonated with listeners on a personal level.
meanings.sent5: The subtext of the sculpture captured the artist's emotional journey.
